main_definition: Humor refers to the quality of being amusing or comic, often expressed through jokes, wit, or funny anecdotes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A natural tendency to laugh and find things funny
meanings_and_examples.example: John has a great sense of humor and can make anyone in the room laugh.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The quality of being amusing or comic, especially as expressed in literature, speech, or other forms of communication
meanings_and_examples.example: Her witty remarks often contain elements of humor that lighten up any conversation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A mood characterized by a feeling of goodwill and amusement
meanings_and_examples.example: The party was in full swing, with everyone sharing jokes and laughter, creating an atmosphere filled with humor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Jokes or comic stories that are intended to be funny
meanings_and_examples.example: She told a hilarious joke about her cat which had the whole room bursting into laughter.
